info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 10:00PM CDT until May 15 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing or expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following county, Valley.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen as of 10 PM CDT, and another 1 inch or so could still fall tonight. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hays Creek, Turtle Creek, Oak Creek, Haskell Creek, Hawthorne Creek, North Branch Mira Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Middle Loup River, Davis Creek, Gravel Creek, North Branch Turtle Creek, Lee Creek, South Branch Turtle Creek, Bean Creek, Dane Creek and South Branch Mira Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Elyria and Fort Hartsuff State Park, along with rural northwestern Valley County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT THURSDAY
